title: futures caused signal: 4, SIGILL: illegal instruction when compiling

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
### Code I'm new to rust and interestingly the base tokio example I was using worked - it went bad when I added the futures crate. ``` lsb_release --all No LSB modules are available. Distributor ID: Debian Description: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) Release: 11 Codename: bullseye ``` ```toml [dependencies] futures = "0.3.21" tokio = { version = "1.20.1", features = ["full"] } ``` ```Rust use futures::Future; use tokio::io::AsyncWrite; use tokio::net::{TcpListener, TcpStream}; #[tokio::main] async fn main() { // Bind the listener to the address let listener = TcpListener::bind("127.0.0.1:6379").await.unwrap(); loop { // The second item contains the IP and port of the new connection. let (socket, addr) = listener.accept().await.unwrap(); println!("{addr:?}"); process(socket).await; } } async fn process(stream: TcpStream) { stream.poll_write(&[1]); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.62.1 (e092d0b6b 2022-07-16)
